detaileddescription.para: The MessageCrossbar this MessageChannel resides on.
A queue of all processes which are currently waiting on this message channel.
A counter keeping track of the messages which were successfully delivered to a waiting process. A message is considered delivered if it was forwarded to at least one waiting process.

A counter keeping track of the messages which could not be delivered to a waiting process. A message is considered lost if it could not be forwarded to any receiver because at the time it was received there was no process waiting on the MessageChannel.
A counter keeping track of processes which are leaving this channel because they were activated, but were activated by a message received on another channel.
A counter keeping track of the processes which were interrupted and removed from this channel because of their max waiting time on the MessageChannel was reached.

memberdef.argsstring: (Model owner, String name, boolean showInTrace, MessageCrossbar< T > messageCrossbar)
memberdef.name: MessageChannel

parameterdescription.para: The model to which this MessageChannel belongs.
Whether to show this MessageChannel in the trace or not.
The MessageCrossbar this MessageChannel is associated with.

detaileddescription.para: Removes the given process from the queue of processes waiting for a message and increments the counter of interrupted waits.

parameterdescription.para: The process to remove from this channel.

detaileddescription.para: Adds a process to the queue of process waiting for a message on this channel.

parameterdescription.para: The process to add to this channel.

simplesect.para: The queue of process waiting for messages on this channel.

detaileddescription.para: Receive a message which leads to the updating of several internal counters and the removal of all waiting processes from this channel.

simplesect.para: A Set of all removed processes.

detaileddescription.para: Removes all processes from this channel which have been activated by a message received on another channel (on which the given processes were also waiting).

simplesect.para: The number of delivered messages. A message is considered delivered if it was forwarded to at least one waiting process.
The number of process which were activated by a message directly received on this channel.
The number of process which were removed from this channel because they were activated (indirectly) by a message received on another channel.
The number of process which were interrupted while waiting on this channel because their max wait time was exceeded.
The number of message which were sent to this channel but couldn't be forwarded to a receiver because no process was waiting on the channel when the message was received.
The number of processes which have been handled by this message channel (meaning processes which entered the channel and also left it again).
The number of process which were removed from this channel because they were activated either by a message received directly on this channel or by a message received (indirectly) on another channel.
The number of messages which were sent to this channel.

detaileddescription.para: Sends the given CrossbarMessage to the channel, thereby activating all processes that are waiting on the channel.

parameterdescription.para: The message to send to the channel.

detaileddescription.para: Wait for a CrossbarMessage on this channel, thereby passivating the current process. The process is not reactivated until a message is received.

Wait for a CrossbarMessage on this channel, thereby passivating the current process. The process is not reactivated until a message is received. The parameter waitUntil specifies the point in time to which the current process will wait for a message. If no message is received before that time the process will be interrupted and a DelayedInterruptException will be thrown.

parameterdescription.para: The point in time up to which the process will wait for a message before the waiting is aborted.
The exception that indicates the process has reached its max wait time and has been interrupted.

detaileddescription.para: Wait for a CrossbarMessage on this channel, thereby passivating the current process. The process is not reactivated until a message is received. The parameter maxWaitTime specifies the time the current process will wait for a message. If no message is received before the wait time has passed the process will be interrupted and a DelayedInterruptException will be thrown.

parameterdescription.para: The time the process will wait for a message before the waiting is aborted.
The exception that indicates the process has reached its max wait time and has been interrupted.

detaileddescription.para:
Represents a message channel which resides on a MessageCrossbar. MessageChannels can only be used in conjunction with a message crossbar.
On the one hand MessageChannels allow for processes to wait for CrossbarMessages on them (passivating the process) and on the other hand they allow for processes to send CrossbarMessages to them. If a CrossbarMessage is received this leads to the immediate activation of all process waiting on the channel.

MessageCrossbar
CrossbarMessage

parameterdescription.para: Parameter restricting the types of processes which can wait on a MessageChannel.
